consent.title: Ready to Get Started?
consent.disclaimer1: TriageX does not provide a diagnosis. It offers level-of-care recommendations based on your input.
consent.disclaimer2: If uncertain, TriageX always recommends the higher level of care.
consent.disclaimer3: If your symptoms worsen or become severe, call emergency services (112) immediately.
consent.disclaimer4: The tool supports, but does not replace, professional medical judgment.
consent.checkboxLabel: I have read and understand the information above. I consent to using TriageX for triage assessment.

partners.label: For Hospital & Regional Leaders
partners.title: A Clinical Command Layer You Can Deploy in Weeks
partners.description: TriageX ingests symptoms, vitals, and local protocols to prioritize cases, guide frontline staff, and feed analytics into your command dashboards.

whyList.item2: Feeds structured data into your EHR and BI stack.
whyList.item3: Built with emergency physicians, meets EU triage standards.

partners.whatDescription: A clinician-built triage platform that adapts to your care pathways, surfaces risk instantly, and routes patients to safe destinations.

quote.text: TriageX gives our nurses a common dashboard and escalates risk before it hits the ED. Integration took under six weeks.

consentSection.title: Ready to Get Started?

noDiagnosis.title: Not a Diagnosis
noDiagnosis.content: TriageX does not provide a diagnosis. It offers level-of-care recommendations based on your input.

higherCare.title: Safety-First Approach
higherCare.content: If uncertain, TriageX always recommends the higher level of care to ensure patient safety.

emergency.title: Emergency Services
emergency.content: If your symptoms worsen or become severe, call emergency services (112) immediately. Do not wait.

judgment.title: Professional Judgment
judgment.content: The tool supports, but does not replace, professional medical judgment. Always consult healthcare providers for serious concerns.

consentSection.checkbox: I have read and understand the information above. I consent to using TriageX for triage assessment.

newsletter.title: Ready to Get the Right Care

footer.description: Medical services are an essential part of our lives, offering care and treatment for various health conditions.

toast.completeFields: Please complete required fields before continuing.
toast.submitError: Please correct the highlighted fields before submitting.

validation.heartRateRange: Heart rate must be between {min}-{max} bpm
validation.bloodPressureFormat: Blood pressure must be in format: systolic/diastolic (e.g., 120/80)

age.title: What is your age?
age.subtitle: This helps us provide age-appropriate recommendations
age.label: Age

gender.title: What is your biological sex?
gender.subtitle: This information helps personalize your assessment

pregnancy.question: Are you currently pregnant?
pregnancy.months: How many months pregnant are you?

symptoms.title: Describe your medical concern
symptoms.subtitle: Tell us about your symptoms or health concern
symptoms.placeholder: Describe your main symptom or concern...

vitals.title: Vital Parameters
vitals.subtitle: Optional: Provide vital signs for more accurate assessment

disclaimer.title: Important:
disclaimer.body: Please use CE-marked medical devices for accurate measurement.

note.title: Note:
note.body: All vital signs are optional but help provide more accurate recommendations.

questions.redness: Is the leg red or discolored?
questions.warmth: Is the leg warm to touch?
questions.duration: How long has the leg been swollen?

questions.radiation: Does the pain radiate to your arm, jaw, or back?
questions.breath: Are you experiencing shortness of breath?

symptom.title: Main Symptom
symptom.description: Describe your primary symptom or concern. Be as specific as possible (e.g., "chest pain", "headache for 3 days", "fever and cough").

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Measure your body temperature using a thermometer. Normal body temperature is around 36.5-37.5�C. Place the thermometer under your tongue or in your armpit for accurate reading.

heart_rate.title: Heart Rate
heart_rate.description: Find your pulse on your wrist or neck. Count the beats for 30 seconds and multiply by 2, or count for a full minute. Normal resting heart rate is 60-100 bpm.

spo2.title: SpO� (Oxygen Saturation)
spo2.description: Measure your blood oxygen level using a pulse oximeter. Place the device on your finger and wait for a reading. Normal SpO� is 95-100%. Values below 90% may indicate a medical emergency.

blood_pressure.title: Blood Pressure
blood_pressure.description: Measure your blood pressure using a blood pressure monitor. Normal blood pressure is typically around 120/80 mmHg. Enter in format: systolic/diastolic (e.g., 120/80).

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: How long have you been experiencing these symptoms? This helps determine the urgency of care needed.

respiratory_rate.title: Respiratory Rate
respiratory_rate.description: Count the number of breaths per minute. Watch the chest rise and fall, count for 30 seconds and multiply by 2, or count for a full minute. Normal respiratory rate is 12-20 breaths per minute for adults.

level_of_consciousness.title: Level of Consciousness
level_of_consciousness.description: Alert: Fully awake and responsive. Responds to voice: Reacts when spoken to. Responds to pain: Only responds to painful stimuli. Unresponsive: No response to any stimuli.

onset.title: Onset
onset.description: Sudden: Symptoms appeared quickly (within minutes). Gradual: Symptoms developed slowly over hours or days. Fluctuating: Symptoms come and go or vary in intensity.

pain_level.title: Pain Level
pain_level.description: Rate your pain on a scale of 0-10. 0 = No pain, 1-3 = Mild pain, 4-6 = Moderate pain, 7-8 = Severe pain, 9-10 = Extreme pain. This helps assess the severity of your condition.

modal.title: Medical History
modal.subtitle: This information helps us provide a more accurate assessment
modal.skipConfirm: Are you sure? Your medical history will be skipped.

conditions.question: Do you have any medical conditions?
conditions.otherPlaceholder: Describe other risk factors or diseases you have...

medications.title: Medications
medications.description: Choose which medications you take regularly (especially blood thinners):
medications.otherPlaceholder: Describe other medications you take regularly...

trauma.question: Recently severe trauma/injury
trauma.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe what happened, when it occurred, and any symptoms...

validation.selectConditionOrText: Please select at least one condition or provide details in the text field
validation.selectMedicationOrText: Please select at least one medication or provide details in the text field
validation.selectTrimesterOrWeeks: Please select a trimester or enter the number of weeks

status.title: Analyzing your health information...
status.subtitle: Please wait while we process your data and assess your risk level.

toasts.apiFallback: We couldn't reach the server. Showing a demo assessment instead.
toasts.copySuccess: Summary copied to clipboard. You can paste it anywhere.
toasts.copyFail: Unable to copy summary. Please try again.
toasts.shareUnsupported: Sharing is not supported on this device.

confidence.label: Confidence
confidence.low: Lower confidence - more information may help

lowConfidence.title: Low Confidence Assessment
lowConfidence.description: Based on the information provided, we have lower confidence in this assessment. For your safety, we recommend:
items: Contact a healthcare provider for further assessment
Provide more detailed symptom information if possible
Monitor your symptoms closely and seek immediate care if they worsen

explanation.title: Key Factors in This Assessment
explanation.subtitle: The following factors influenced this recommendation:

fallback.safety: If symptoms worsen, contact emergency services immediately.

disclaimer.title: Important:
disclaimer.body: TriageX does not provide a diagnosis. It offers level-of-care recommendations based on your input. If your symptoms worsen or become severe, call emergency services (112) immediately. The tool supports, but does not replace, professional medical judgment.

self_care.title: Self-Care
self_care.description: Mild symptoms, safe to monitor at home.

primary_care.title: Primary Care
primary_care.description: Non-urgent, see a doctor if symptoms persist.

semi_emergency.title: Semi-Emergency
semi_emergency.description: Possible risk  seek care within hours.

self_care.message: Mild symptoms that can be safely managed at home.
recommendations: Rest, stay hydrated, and get adequate sleep
Track your symptoms for any changes
Seek medical care if symptoms suddenly worsen
self_care.safety: If new symptoms appear or you feel worse, contact healthcare services.

primary_care.message: Non-urgent, but medical review recommended within 24-48 hours.
recommendations: Schedule an appointment with your primary care provider
primary_care.safety: This assessment has lower confidence due to incomplete information. Please contact a healthcare provider for further assessment.

semi_emergency.message: Potential risk detectedseek care within a few hours.
recommendations: Arrange transportation to a healthcare facility
Have someone stay with you and monitor symptoms
Bring your medical history and medication list
semi_emergency.safety: If symptoms escalate or breathing becomes difficult, call emergency services immediately.

emergency.message: Critical symptoms detectedseek emergency care immediately.
recommendations: Do not drive yourself; wait for medical transport
Keep the airway clear and follow dispatcher instructions
Have someone gather medications and ID for responders
emergency.safety: Stay on the line with emergency services until help arrives.

hero.title: About TriageX
hero.subtitle: Building the future of healthcare triage through AI-powered decision support.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Make healthcare triage accessible, accurate, and safe by combining AI with evidence-based medical logic.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where every patient receives timely, appropriate care guidance while AI triage shortens wait times.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: Built by clinicians, data scientists, engineers, and healthcare innovators.

clinical.description: Decades of emergency medicine, primary care, and triage experience keep our AI aligned with best practices.

ai.title: AI Innovation
ai.description: Cutting-edge AI models learn from real-world triage data while maintaining safety and interpretability.

compliance.title: Compliance & Trust
compliance.description: Designed with regulatory compliance and patient safety at the core. We maintain the highest standards for privacy and security.
compliance.footer: Regular security audits, compliance reviews, and clinical validation keep us aligned with the highest standards.
